title: Madison Beer opts for sporty look in cropped hoodie and leggings on outing in Beverly Hills
text:
She got her 15 minutes of fame thanks to Justin Bieber in 2012.

And Madison Beer managed to turn it into a recording career with her upcoming debut album Life Support supposed to be released before the end of the year.

On Thursday, Beer, 20, was snapped out and about in Beverly Hills where she lunched with a friend.

Outing: Madison Beer, 20, who found fame in 2012 thanks to Justin Bieber, was snapped out and about in Beverly Hills on Thursday

Beer opted for a casual athleisure wear look pairing a cropped gray hoodie with black leggings and white socks and trainers.

Her long brunette hair was loose and she sported black-framed spectacles.

She had a black purse over one shoulder and accessorized with gold hoop earrings and a gold pendant necklace.

Sporty: Beer opted for a casual athleisure wear look pairing a cropped gray hoodie with black leggings

Relaxed: She stepped out in white socks and trainers and had a black purse over one shoulder. Her long brunette hair was loose and she sported black-framed spectacles

Had company: Beer headed to lunch with a friend

Madison shot to fame at the age of 13 when Justin Bieber posted a YouTube link to Twitter of her belting out At Last, a 1941 number that was was most famously sung by Etta James on her 1960 debut album At Last!.

Justin, who at that point was already a major celebrity, wrote: 'wow. 13 years old! she can sing. great job. #futurestar'.

Madison explained to Teen Vogue back in 2017 that Justin has, in the intervening time, 'become a good friend' of hers.

Singer: Although her singing was discovered by BIeber when she was 13, it took until last year for Beer to get around to releasing her first EP, As She Pleases

She said: 'I think we’ve been able to connect because we were both discovered on YouTube and have a common understanding just from that.'

It took until 2018 for Beer to get around to releasing her first EP, As She Pleases.

On November 9, 2018, she released Hurts Like Hell featuring Offset and this past May released Dear Society, a single from her yet-to-be-released debut album.
